title: Leicester City insist their support for manager Claudio Ranieri is "unwavering" despite poor form

Leicester have backed manager Claudio Ranieri, issuing a vote of confidence ahead of the club's FA Cup replay clash with Derby. 
The Foxes are on a terrible run of form and are now just two points off the foot of the table. 
Ranieri is the bookies' favourite to be the next Premier League manager sacked, but the club insisted in a statement that their support for him is "unwavering". 
The statement continued: "While there is a collective appreciation from everyone at the Club that recent form needs to improve, the unprecedented success achieved in recent seasons has been based firmly on stability, togetherness and determination to overcome even the greatest of challenges." Leicester are two points off the bottom of the table (Photo: 2017 Getty Images) The Statement in full: 
In light of recent speculation, Leicester City Football Club would like to make absolutely clear its unwavering support for its First Team Manager, Claudio Ranieri. While there is a collective appreciation from everyone at the Club that recent form needs to improve, the unprecedented success achieved in recent seasons has been based firmly on stability, togetherness and determination to overcome even the greatest of challenges. The entire Club is and will remain united behind its manager and behind its players, collectively and firmly focused on the challenges ahead. Like us on Facebook
